content: pattern or you ve run out of colour a there is no need to count row just stick to the x2 k sts of each colour and the pattern will magically appear before your eyes tip for colour management there isn t really a need to worry about colour dominance in this pattern but i would recommend you always have one ball on each side of you throughout the project i kept the darker colour to my right and the lighter on theleft being conscious not to twist the two don t worry about catching floats either they re tiny top rib continuing with larger needles and colour b work one round in k until last 2 stitches kfb 140 stitches place the stitch marker the magic of an odd number of stitches for the body means that if you stick to the x2 sts with smaller needles and using colour b work 6 row of 2x2 rib k2 p2 this should be around 2 5cm colour a then x2 sts colour b then the pattern forms without any charts or counting bind off in pattern https //www youtube com/watch v=i1rpfmin7s8 knitting in the round is essentially just one big spiral the red line shows the true start of the finishing round as it shifts by one stitch weave in your ends and if you feel it necessary you can wash and block the cowl
